intro: Oreobolopsis tepalifera, commonly known as the tepal-flowered oreobolopsis, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, often pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers are borne in clusters and are often surrounded by modified leaves called tepals, which give the plant its common name. Oreobolopsis tepalifera is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
